From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia




2021 Indian filmLahore ConfidentialPromotional posterDirected byKunal KohliWritten byS. Hussain ZaidiVibha SinghProduced byAjay RaiStarring
Richa Chadda
Karishma Tanna
Arunoday Singh
CinematographyKarthik GaneshEdited byNikhil PariharProductioncompanyJAR PicturesDistributed byZEE5Release date
4 February 2021 (2021-02-04)
Running time68 minutesCountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Lahore Confidential is a 2021 Indian Hindi-language spy thriller film which was premiered on ZEE5 in February 2021. The film is directed by Kunal Kohli.[1] It is created by S. Hussain Zaidi and stars Richa Chadda and Arunoday Singh. The film is about R&AW agents in Lahore investigating Pakistani terrorist group's role in activities related to terror. This movie is a sequel of 2020 film London Confidential, which was premiered in 2020 on ZEE5.


Plot[edit]
The Story revolves around a humble Indian woman named Ananya Srivastav (Richa Chadda), who works with RAW. In order to get away from her mundane life, she wanted an overseas assignment from the government. But she finds herself on a secret intelligence duty in Pakistan.

Cast[edit]
Richa Chadda as Ananya Srivastav
Karishma Tanna as Yukti
Arunoday Singh as Rauf Ahmed Kazmi / Wasim Ahmed Khan
Alka Amin as Mrs. Srivastav, Ananya's mother
Khalid Siddiqui as RD
Kanan Arunachalam as Subramaniam
Abdullah Osman as Pathan
Fareed Khan as Qadir Bhai
Release[edit]
Lahore Confidential was premiered on ZEE5 on 4 February 2021.[2]

Reception[edit]
Lahore confidential did not receive a great response. It was regarded as an abject movie with zero thrills. It was also said that director Kunal Kohli had nothing new to offer in this film.[3][4][5]

References[edit]


^ "Kunal Kohli: Filming Lahore Confidential amid pandemic was tough, but glad to resume work". Indian Express. 31 January 2021. Retrieved 21 May 2021.

^ "Zee5's Lahore Confidential gets new release date; premiere set for 4 February". cinestaan.com. Archived from the original on 20 May 2021. Retrieved 20 May 2021.

^ Kumar, Pradeep (4 February 2021). "'Lahore Confidential' movie review: An exercise in vain". The Hindu. Retrieved 23 May 2021.

^ "Lahore Confidential Movie Review: Half Hearted Attempt at Espionage Drama". The Hindu. 4 February 2021. Retrieved 23 May 2021.

^ "LAHORE CONFIDENTIAL REVIEW : AN AVERAGE ESPIONAGE WITH A ROMANTIC TWIST". Times of india. 4 February 2021. Retrieved 12 May 2022.
